author: Diario de Ávila
title: El Real Madrid bate al colista ALBA con otro récord de Llull
text: Baloncesto - Euroliga El Real Madrid bate al colista ALBA con otro récord de Llull Europa Press - jueves, 26 de diciembre de 2024 69 ALBA Berlín 80 Real Madrid Victoria merengue sin sustos en Berlín, a pocos días de afrontar un nuevo Clásico liguero El Real Madrid bate al colista ALBA con otro récord de Llull - Foto: FILIP SINGER El Real Madrid ha ganado este jueves por 69-80 en su visita al ALBA Berlin durante la jornada 18 de la liga regular en la Euroliga, última cita continental de los merengues antes de terminar el 2024 y que ha servido al base español Sergio Llull para batir otro récord, ya convertido en el jugador con más partidos disputados en este torneo.A dos minutos y pico de zanjar el cuarto inaugural, Llull saltó a la cancha del Uber Arena e igualó los 425 encuentros que en su día había alcanzado Kyle Hines. Además, el base de Mahón propulsó al equipo blanco colando un triple en su primer tiro y que situó el 13-23 en el marcador.Hasta la irrupción del 'Increíble', Dzanan Musa había acaparado el protagonismo del ataque visitante. No en vano, 10 de los primeros 13 puntos del Real Madrid habían sido del alero bosnio, con repertorio de entradas al aro, triples y bandejas. Junto a la dirección de juego de Facu Campazzo y los contragolpes de Mario Hezonja, la brecha creció.Para mayor inri, Llull estaba inspirado y casi sobre la bocina metió otro triple que abrochó el primer cuarto en 15-28. El siguiente periodo empezó con una dinámica similar, incluidos dos nuevos triples de Llull junto a otro de Hugo González, aumentando la ventaja merengue hasta el 21-38 y dejando al ALBA contra las cuerdas demasiado pronto.Sin embargo, los pupilos de Israel González se engancharon a la pelea poco antes del descanso, gracias sobre todo a la aportación de Matteo Spagnolo desde la bombilla y de David McCormack en el poste bajo. Un 8-0 de parcial hasta llegar al intermedio (34-45) mitigó la sensación de inferioridad en el conjunto berlinés, que volvió bien de su vestuario.Un triple rápido de Tim Schneider así lo evidenció, pero comenzaron a carburar Gaby Deck y Walter Tavares entre las filas madridistas para mantener la calma en un tercer periodo donde el ALBA acusaba su escasa puntería desde más allá del arco. Al menos Yanni Wetzell sí transformaba tiros libres, dejando en -10 (51-61) la distancia de los locales.De manera paulatina, el ALBA se había acercado (55-64) hasta hacer saltar alguna alarma en el banquillo de Chus Mateo, quien recurrió de nuevo a Llull y otorgó galones en el juego interior a Usman Garuba por delante de Serge Ibaka para dosificar a un 'Edy' Tavares irregular en tareas ofensivas, pero igualmente intimidante en defensa.A 7:04 para concluir el duelo, Garuba se retiró de la pista para que los médicos del Real Madrid cortase la hemorragia en su rostro tras un codazo involuntario de McCormack. La acción se saldó como falta normal del pívot recién fichado por un ALBA que tenía pocos argumentos más en su intento de remontada, aparte de algunos arreones de Malte Delow.Sin sustos, el cuadro merengue apretó atrás para asegurarse un final tranquilo y Hezonja se animó con más canastas, incluyendo un mate de cara a la galería, sellando el triunfo visitante. El Real Madrid se puso de este modo con un balance de 9-9, cerca de la zona del 'play-in'; por su parte, el equipo alemán sigue colista con un registro de 3-15. , , , , ,

author: Lívia Carvalho
title: Com internação de Paulo Miklos, Titãs fará turnê de reencontro sem ele
text:
O cantor Paulo Miklos está internado no Hospital Samaritano, em São Paulo, desde a manhã do dia 11 de dezembro e deverá ter alta em breve
A banda de rock Titãs está em turnê de reencontro pelo Brasil e deverá seguir a agenda de show sem o cantor Paulo Miklos, de 65 anos, que está internado desde a última quarta-feira, 11, no Hospital Samaritano, em São Paulo. O próximo compromisso do roqueiros é no Terra SP, em São Paulo, nesta sexta-feira, 20, e está com reposição na formação que se apresentará aos paulistanos.
Os veteranos Sérgio Britto, Branco Mello e Tony Bellotto serão acompanhados por Beto Lee e Mario Fabre, na guitarra e bateria, respectivamente.
Em nota enviada à imprensa, a equipe da banda esclareceu os substitutos. “Como um organismo coletivo que suplanta as individualidades que o compõem, os Titãs seguem determinados, impulsionados por inquietação e ambição artística, e orgulho das glórias conquistadas”, diz no comunicado.
Internado após diagnóstico de gastroenterite, o cantor Paulo Miklos parece já ter uma data para deixar o Hospital Samaritano, em São Paulo.
Em entrevista à Quem Renata Galvão, esposa do artista, abriu o jogo sobre o estado de saúde do marido e revelou que ele receberá alta e deverá deixar o hospital já na próxima sexta-feira, 20.
Vale lembrar que, de acordo com a mulher do famoso, seu quadro não era grave e ele não foi para unidade de terapia intensiva (UTI). Na última quinta-feira, 12, Galvão confirmou o diagnóstico de gastroenterite e enfatizou que a condição de Miklos era estável, afastando rumores sobre a gravidade do caso.
A equipe do cantor afirmou que ele está "em processo de cura e evolui muito bem, sem intercorrências".
A gastroenterite é uma inflamação ou infecção que afeta o tubo digestivo. Em casos mais significativos, o paciente pode precisar de UTI. Isso acontece em caso de infecção bacteriana na corrente sanguínea, provocada por uma quebra da barreira protetora do intestino, segundo informa o Dr. Lucio Lucas, Cirurgião do Aparelho Digestivo do Hospital Sírio-Libanês em Brasília.
Leia também: Médico explica diagnóstico de Paulo Miklos: 'Manifestação intensa'
|

author: Laura Tickey
title: A case for celebrating the leap day
text: In case you didn’t know, we’re in a leap year. It’s a phenomenon that occurs every four years since the calendar year and earth’s orbit don’t quite align. It actually takes Earth 365 days and about six hours to orbit the sun. So, we add in an extra day at the end of February to keep the calendar consistent with the seasons. Without a leap day, after hundreds of years, Halloween might be in the spring, celebrated with flowers rather than crisp fallen leaves. The solstices would eventually land on different months, and our concept of time and seasons would falter. I’m thankful that the leap day keeps the holidays more chilly and lets my birthday fall in the warm summertime. However, the concept of leap day makes me think about how deeply we’re all rooted in this reality. We see seasons as certainties, but what if that wasn’t the case? Maybe we can make leap day our own holiday, where we could detach from our reality and consider what things would be like if they were flipped upside down. My family and I used to celebrate leap day with pancakes for dinner — classic “opposite day” fashion, but I suggest that we all take this concept even further. What if we celebrated rainy days instead of spending them locked inside? What if people rushed out to the streets to bask in the clouds and bathe in the downpour? What if sunlight was the ambiance that adorned our stay-at-home days? Leap day falls a few weeks before the spring solstice, where gray skies and volatile weather drag on. It’s a perfect time to turn our weather and world upside down. Go mix up your routine, eat at a random restaurant for lunch and talk to people you’d never consider talking to. I can only see something good — or at least funny and interesting — coming out of it. In fact, Ireland uses this day to flip traditional gender roles in the old leap day tradition for women to get down on one knee and propose to their partner. Feel free to take this idea if you’d like. As for me, I plan to celebrate the leap day by implementing some changes into my ordinary daily routine. I’ll start the day by using the Calm app. I’ve always heard about the benefits of waking up and listening to meditations to help you practice gratitude and mindfulness, but I never gave it a try. On February 29, instead of waking up in a hurried rush to get to class, I’ll wake up early and spend some time on myself, which may prove beneficial. Next, I’d like to try something completely insane and not wear my AirPods when walking to class. I’ve become so accustomed to listening to music while walking down Commonwealth Avenue that I can barely remember what the raw street sounds like. I’m going to challenge myself to not enter my little Spotify world, and be more in touch with my surroundings. We’ll see whether this opens my eyes to a new routine or just leaves me feeling unsatisfied. Either way, I think that leap day is the perfect time to try it. Now, as a notorious picky eater, I’d like to try something very challenging. On leap day, I’m going to do something very far away from my comfort zone and eat the foods that I have callously sworn off. Maybe I’ll try olives, despite years of my younger self insisting that they taste like pickled tires. I could put yellow mustard on a hot dog rather than my trusty ketchup. I could eat beans and miraculously get over their evil and mushy texture. Eventually, I might find that I’ve grown into liking something that I’ve always hated. If our whole concept of time is based on something so abstract, I don’t see why we should take everything else so seriously — at least not everyday. I propose that from now on we celebrate Feb. 29 as our day to dare. Whether you choose to sing a song on the BU Shuttle or show up to class in pajamas, I hope you also take the day to try something completely out of your comfort zone. Who cares? It’s leap day!

author: Mike Vilensky
title: California Officer Injured on Job Loses Bid for Higher Leave Pay
text:
A California corrections officer entitled to an increase in workers’ compensation after an attack by inmates can’t apply the increase to enhanced benefits for public employees, California’s top court said Thursday.
The ruling from California’s Supreme Court affirmed a lower court decision that Michael Ayala’s recoverable compensation applies to workers’ compensation disability payments and not the more generous “industrial disability leave payments” for public employees.
Ayala was injured while working for the Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation. Under California’s workers’ compensation law, an employee injured because of his employer’s willful misconduct gets a 50% increase in recoverable compensation.
